metadata.Title: CVE-2017-5522 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Stack-based buffer overflow in MapServer before 6.0.6, 6.2.x before 6.2.4, 6.4.x before 6.4.5, and 7.0.x before 7.0.4 allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (crash) or execute arbitrary code via vectors involving WFS get feature requests.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-5522` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

cgi-mapserver - 7.0.0-9ubuntu3.1
libmapscript-java - 7.0.0-9ubuntu3.1
libmapscript-perl - 7.0.0-9ubuntu3.1
libmapserver2 - 7.0.0-9ubuntu3.1
mapserver-bin - 7.0.0-9ubuntu3.1
python-mapscript - 7.0.0-9ubuntu3.1
ruby-mapscript - 7.0.0-9ubuntu3.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: mapserver package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '7.0.0-9ubuntu3.1').
